contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name=Gulpen-Wittem |native_name=''Gullepe-Wittem'' |image_skyline=Gulpecentrum.JPG |imagesize= |image_caption=The river Gulp in the centre of Gulpen |image_flag=Gulpen-Wittem flag.svg |flag_size=120x100px |image_shield=Gulpen-Wittem wapen.svg |shield_size=120x100px |image_map=LocatieGulpen-Wittem.png |mapsize=250px |latd=50|latm=48|lats=|latNS=N |longd=5|longm=53|longs=|longEW=E |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region=NL |subdivision_type=Country |subdivision_name=[[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1=Province |subdivision_name1=[[Limburg (Netherlands)|Limburg]] |area_footnotes=(2006) |area_total_km2=73.37 |area_land_km2=73.18 |area_water_km2=0.19 |population_as_of=1 January 2007 |population_note=Source: [[Statistics Netherlands|CBS]], [http://statline.cbs.nl/ Statline]. |settlement_type=Municipality |population_total=14847 |population_density_km2=203 |timezone=[[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset=+1 |timezone_DST=[[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset_DST=+2 }} '''Gulpen-Wittem''' ({{Pronunciation|132 Gulpen-Wittem.ogg}}) ({{lang-li|Gullepe-Wittem}}) is a municipality in the southeastern Netherlands (in the province of [[Limburg (Netherlands)|Limburg]]) with 14.677 inhabitants as of 2008. Gulpen-Wittem came into being after the merger of the municipalities [[Gulpen]] and [[Wittem]]. This took place after a request of both municipalities. At the time of the merger, both municipalities had about 8000 inhabitants, although Wittem was bigger than Gulpen. The town hall was situated in Gulpen, and has kept its function as town hall in the new municipality. The former town hall of Wittem was situated in a manor house in [[Mechelen, Netherlands|Mechelen]] since 1986, which is now being used as a "nursing hostel". The municipality is very rural, with a lot of castles, half-timbered houses and old monumental farms. Yearly, Gulpen-Wittem attracts many tourists from the entire country because of its relatively sloping landscape, especially during the summer. ==Population centres== Beertsenhoven, [[Berghem, Limburg|Berghem]], Berghof, Beutenaken, Billinghuizen, Bissen, Bommerig, Broek, Cartils, Crapoel, Dal, De Hut, Diependal, Dijk, Elkenrade, Elzet, [[Epen]], Eperheide, Etenaken, Euverem, [[Eys]], Eyserheide, Gracht, [[Gulpen]], Heijenrath, [[Helle, Gulpen-Wittem|Helle]], Hilleshagen, Höfke, Hurpesch, Ingber, Kapolder, Kleeberg, Kosberg, Kuttingen, Landsrade, [[Mechelen, Netherlands|Mechelen]], Mingersberg, Nijswiller, Overeys, Overgeul, Partij, Pesaken, Piepert, Plaat, [[Reijmerstok]], Schilberg, Schweiberg, Sinselbeek, [[Slenaken]], Stokhem, Terlinden, Terpoorten, Terziet, Trintelen, Wahlwiller, Waterop, [[Wijlre]], [[Wittem]]. ==Slenaken== Slenaken was founded in 1850. ==Wijlre== The [[Brand Brewery]] is in '''Wijlre'''. ==External links== *[http://www.gulpen-wittem.nl Official website] {{commons category}} <!--Please note that not all directions need to be filled--> <!--Please note that preferably only neighboring municipalities or bodies of water should be used--> {{Geographic location |Centre = Gulpen-Wittem |North = [[Voerendaal]] |Northeast = [[Simpelveld]] |East = [[Aachen]] ([[Germany|DE]]-[[North Rhine-Westphalia|NW]])<br>[[Vaals]] |Southeast = [[Plombières]] ([[Belgium|BE]]-[[Liège (province)|WLG]]) |South = |Southwest = [[Voeren]] ([[Belgium|BE]]-[[Limburg (Belgium)|VLI]]) |West = [[Eijsden-Margraten]] |Northwest = [[Valkenburg aan de Geul]] }} {{Limburg Province (Netherlands)}} [[Category:Municipalities of Limburg (Netherlands)]] {{LimburgNL-geo-stub}}
